document: Brute Force Algorithms and related combinatorial problems, including string matching, polynomial evaluation, closest‑pair, traveling salesman, knapsack, assignment problem, and the strengths/weaknesses of exhaustive search.

questions.question: What is the time complexity of a brute‑force string matching algorithm in the worst case?
During a brute‑force string search, what is the first step?
options: Align the pattern at the beginning of the text
Compare the last character of the pattern to the text
Compute the length of the text
Slide the pattern one position to the right
questions.answer: Align the pattern at the beginning of the text

questions.question: In a brute‑force polynomial evaluation, how many multiplications does the simple nested loop algorithm perform?
Which method reduces the polynomial evaluation from Θ(n²) to Θ(n)?
What is the time complexity of a brute‑force closest‑pair algorithm?
Which strategy is suggested to make the closest‑pair problem faster than brute force?
A main strength of brute‑force algorithms is that they are:
options: Very fast for large data sets

questions.question: A typical weakness of brute‑force algorithms is that they:
In exhaustive search, the first step is to:
options: Sort the candidate set by cost

questions.question: The traveling salesman problem has how many possible tours?
What is the time complexity of exhaustively searching all subsets in a knapsack problem?
An item subset can be represented by a binary string of length ___ in the knapsack exhaustive search?
The assignment problem has how many possible assignments for n people and n jobs?
Which algorithm solves the assignment problem in O(n³) time?
Exhaustive search is realistically feasible only when the instance size:
In brute‑force polynomial evaluation, which step computes powers of x from right to left?
Which distance metric is typically used in the closest‑pair brute‑force algorithm?
In a brute‑force string matching, what happens when a mismatch is detected?
options: The pattern is realigned one position to the right and searching continues
All comparisons are restarted from scratch
The text is shifted left by one
questions.answer: The pattern is realigned one position to the right and searching continues

questions.question: What kind of search does a brute‑force algorithm perform when looking for an element with a special property?
Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a strength of brute‑force algorithms?
options: Reasonable performance on large data sets
Yields reasonable algorithms for some important problems
questions.answer: Reasonable performance on large data sets

questions.question: Which technique is mentioned in the lecture as a better alternative to exhaustive search?
In the brute‑force string matching algorithm, how many comparisons are done for a text of length n and pattern of length m?
